children.value: Have you ever played the game "rock, scissor, pepers"? That's a funny game, and it's fair on the premise that no one cheated.

Just imagine this scenario: There is a essential gambling between A and B. And the "rock, scissor, papers" is the most important part of the gambling, A and B are both notorious for their expertise in cheating. To make sure that the gambling is fair, you must thought out of a way which is easy to understand and realize.

The first step to stop cheating is to understand how to cheat. So, how will the cheater do? If I want to cheat, I will not show my decition until my enemy show his decition. What I show is based on what the enemy show so I will win. However, if the enemy uses the same trick, the game won't end.
So, the game won't be fair until the problem that each side can't show their decition the same time, which is very hard to solve. What's your idea about this problem?
force each other to tell their decition to the the third person
, who is reliable enough and he won't tell anyone the other's dicition and he won't accept bribes and revise the other's decition surreptitiously.
But there is a obvious loophole:
How to make sure that the third person is reliable?

This gambling is really important to each side, and you know A and B well, they are very good at cheating so it's quite possible that they will do everything they can to make the third person do as they will. Remember, no one in the world is always reliable, so
the approach is hard to practice.

There are nothing always reliable except math.
In order for you to understand this approach, we have to introduce a new concept named "hash".

Hash is a concept in cryptographic programming. To simplifiy this conception, you can take it as a function that has one input and one output, which it is quite easy to get the output from the input and almost impossible to get the input from the output by using it.
What's more, one output only correspond to one input, which means that if b = hash(a), b = hash(c), then a equals to c.
How to take the advantage of the special properity of hashing?
both side thought out of a random num, and keep the num as a secret.
both side calculate the hash of their num.
both side provide their hash to the other, the sequence is not importent.
after both side's hash are provided, both side show their own num.

both side check whether or not the other had cheated by using the hash algorighm to calc the num of the other's hash, the hash algorithm is open to each other so that it's not difficult. if the hash equals to the hash the other provide before, the other is honest.

The first solution is the traditional solution to most of problems about truth: To find a man or institution which each sides trust, such as bank.
The second solution is a super cool solution to these kinds of problems: By some means of cryptographic, which the blockchain uses and have got a great success by.
Have you ever played the game "rock, scissor, pepers"? That's a funny game, and it's fair on the premise that no one cheated.

children.text: How to take the advantage of the special properity of hashing?

contents.title: No4FermatAlgorithm AGreatWayToCheakWhetherOrNotAIntNumIsAPrimeNum
contents.description: I presuppose that you know what prime num is.

children.value: I presuppose that you know what prime num is.
How to judge whether or not a
This solution is easy to thought out. Just traversing from
, if any num being traversed if divisible by

props.code:
def is_prime(n):  # the input num n is the num we want to judge
 if n == 1: return False  # special judge, if the num is one, then it's not a prime num
 for i in range(2, n):  # try every int num in [2, n-1] 
  if not n%i: return False  # i < n, so if n%i == 0, then n must be a composite num.
 return True  # if there are no num which is between 1 and n-1 is divisible by n, then n is a prime num

children.value: # the input num n is the num we want to judge
# special judge, if the num is one, then it's not a prime num
# try every int num in [2, n-1]
# i < n, so if n%i == 0, then n must be a composite num.
# if there are no num which is between 1 and n-1 is divisible by n, then n is a prime num
If you are a more skilled programmer or you are sensitive to numbers, you may thought out that we can just traversing int num from 2 to
for that any composite num could be divided into num pairs like a and b which c==a*b and if a was bigger that

props.code:
def is_prime_1(n):  # same to the code above
 if n == 1: return False
 for i in range(2, int(n**0.5)+1):  # try every int num in [2, int(sqrt(i))]
  if not n%i: return False
 return True

children.value: # try every int num in [2, int(sqrt(i))]
So, we can try some random num in
, if with the random num a,
must not be a prime num. However, if
, then it's still possible that p is not a prime num, so we must check it for serveral times.

props.code:
def fermat(n):
 if n==2: return True  # same to the code above.
 if n&1==1 or n==1: return False  # Special judge, if n is a even num and n is not 2 or n is 1, it's not a prime num. 

 for i in range(15):
  a = random.randint(2, n-1)  # randomly choice a num from 2 to n-1
  if pow(a, n-1, n) != 1: return False  # if the (n-1)th power of a mod n is not equal to 1, n must be a composite num.
 
 return True  # else n is very likely to be a prime num

Out of Control (Out of Control: The New Biology of Machines, Social Systems, and the Economic World) is a fantastic book which is one of the best book for those who want to know about

The theme of this book is decentralization, which is quite geek. This book didn't get too much attention for that many of the concepts in this book were just emerging at that time. What really amaze me is that when the first edition of this book was pressed, there was no internet, and there was no cryptocurrency until 2008 when Satoshi Nakamoto presenting it.
This book had really influced me a lot.

Before reading this book, centralization thinking firmly occupy my mind. In my opinion before I read this book, if one thing are not controled by others, it will be very terrible, the model of the world in my opinion at that time is just like a pyramid which means the people in the topest floor contron the second topest, the second topest control the third topest...

After reading this book, I realized that the world was not all centralized. The Internet
is a great sample.
In the Internet, most of the community are decentralized, they are autonomous, only controled by the admins elected by the netizens and they worked well.

The wikipedia is one of the most famous and awesome website, the breath and volume of the encyclopedia really shocked me. It's hard to imagine that wikipedia could be built without the Internet. Despite the lack of academic recognition, the wikipedia have got lots of people's recogniton. What's really crazy is that there are no people who sensor the wikipedia, the wikipedia is just the result of more than 300,000 editors' work who love to share their knowledge with others.

The reddit canvas is another example. In April Fool's Day in 2017, reddit held the activity for the first time and the activity was held every five years, which attracted many people joining in. The work in the end is really awesome.
The power of decentralization is awesome the the forces of it is developing very fast.If you want to understand the Internet, the web3, the IOT, the cryptocurrency, I recommend you to read this book.

contents.title: No9PhysicalBookPdfAndGitbook
contents.description: As a programmer, it's a good way to enjoy a systematic learning by reading books. But the fact is that different kinds of book you are reading may result in different ending.

children.value: As a programmer, it's a good way to enjoy a systematic learning by reading books. But the fact is that different kinds of book you are reading may result in different ending.

Physical books are the most original books. Today there still lots of people who love physical books rather than digital one reasonably for that physical books "have more sentiment". What's more, you don't have to be care about data traction by reading physical books while others's data may be collected. You will also be more focused for that there are no interference like ads.

However, the physical books may not fits you if you are a programmer. Most codes in physical books are not highlighted for the limitation that most of books are pressed with only one or two colors. If you learn coding by reading physical books, you may felt terrible.
PDF(Portable Document Format) books are widespreaded in the Internet reasonably for that
file could be open in all mainstream browsers developed by Adobe.
is the most well-known digital book file format for that it won't be reshaped either being opened in tablet or being opened in computer.
The weakness of PDF books is that the code indent may be terrible if you copy the code from the
file to your IDE, which is unacceptable for

The problem is that the gitbook usually depends on the internet, so once the owner delete the gitbook or the pictures of the gitbook was lost, you will have trouble in reading it.

The convex hull means the outermost points in the two-dimentional plane.
The main idea of this algorithm is showed below:
put these points in a list and sort this list by the key
iter from the first point the end point, and judge whether pop out the stack or press the point in the stack by cross.
iter from the second from the bottom to the second point, do the same as above.

props.code:
def get_cross(a, b, c):
    u = (b[0]-a[0], b[1]-a[1])
    v = (c[0]-b[0], c[1]-b[1])

    cross = u[0]*v[1] - u[1]*v[0]
    return cross


def andrew(n, l):  # n is the number of these points, l is the list which contain these points
    l = [(0, 0)] + sorted(l)
    
    tb_l = []
    for i in l[1:]:
        while len(tb_l) >= 2 and get_cross(tb_l[-2], tb_l[-1], i) <= 0:
            del tb_l[-1]
        tb_l.append(i)

    f_cvx = len(tb_l)
    for i in l[n-1:1:-1]:
        while len(tb_l) > f_cvx and get_cross(tb_l[-2], tb_l[-1], i) <= 0:
            del tb_l[-1]
        tb_l.append(i)

    return tb_l

children.value: # n is the number of these points, l is the list which contain these points

contents.title: No11Meditation TheBestWayToRelax
contents.description: In modern life, most of the people are busy all day and some feel so stressed that they can't felt asleep, which is really terrible. If you have met the same problem, you'd better try meditation.

children.value: In modern life, most of the people are busy all day and some feel so stressed that they can't felt asleep, which is really terrible. If you have met the same problem, you'd better try meditation.

When talking about meditation, you may associate it with region. Although meditation had been a traditional regional activity in the ancient time, the effect of meditation have been proven by modern brain science. Meditation is common even in some technical companies such as Apple which the created of it, Steve Jobs, took meditations almost every day while alive, Google and Facebook for that it has been experimental proven that after meditation one's creativity and concentration will increase.
It's very easy to get started with meditation without any cost. All you require taking meditation are just a place where there is no noise, a timer, and a bench or other thing to sit on.
Set the timer to remind you five minutes or anytime you want to take meditation for later.
Sit on the bench, close your eyes, and put your attention on your breath.

It's quite normal to wander off. After realizing you had wandered off, put your attention on your breath again slightly. Don't feel guilty about mind wandering, it's just a way your brain take relax and self-regulation.

That's really easy, Isn't it?
After holding on for a while, you will get more focused and fall into sleep easily.

contents.title: But what is objectivity?
contents.description: Warning:Thisarticleissubjective.

children.value: Nowadays, many people condemn some the other people or institution "not objective" whose mantra is "As a XX(like an open source institution or commercial company), you should be objective and not express any view on OO(like politic)", which sounds "objective". Are those who demand objectivity from others really objective?
Whether one object is objective or subjective is a philosophical problem.
One is objective when it's science based and measurable, not one's like or dislike, so personal opinions must be subjective.
Wikipedia is a famous encyclopedia which shows each opinion and don't judge them as far as possible.
, it's objective as it shows few emotional leans most of the time.
My answer to the problem in background
In my opinion, they are not objective
as in fact they show emotional leans that depress other opinion(usually selectively).

links.text: My answer to the problem in background

children.value: It's hard for someone to fall asleep who only sleep far less than eight hours each day, which make them tired during the day. Here are some tips for them which may include you.
The main reason for lack of sleep is playing mobile phone. So you may need to lock your mobile in the evening with some locker apps such as tomato to-do.

Lots of modern people are lack of sports, and it's also a reason for lacking of sleep.
If you are one of them lacking of sports, try some aerobics. Remember not to do sports before time for sleeping as you may be too excited and hard to fall asleep quickly.
The main purpose for sleeping is to rest, not to sleep. It's a misconception many people have that one must sleep every day while other actions can't take place of it.
In fact, you can rest yourself just by closing your eyes. Remember, closing eyes is just enough for resting.
There has been a long debate on which is the best editor between
, which is called "The editor war". I prefer Vim better than Emacs and here is why.
In most of the conditions, while editing a document with other document editors, one usually has to move his hand to the arrow key when he wants to move the cursor inconveniently.
However, this problem was solved with vim editing with moving cursor only with "h" corresponding to
which is easy to type without leaving the keyboard.

Vim is the successor of Vi, which date back to when mouse had not been invented. So, using mouse is not necessary while using Vim, which means that it's very suitable for editing documents on a remote server with SSH.
Vim is strong enough for almost any operation you want, such as moving the cursor anywhere, cut, copy and replace.
It's hard not to commit that Vim is at least one of the best editor of the world which editing could be a happy trip with, have a try with it and enjoy!

contents.title: An introduction to Singapore
contents.description: Singapore is a famous country located in South East Asia which is a developed country with the fastest Internet speed, the lowest corruption and the prosperous economy among the four tigers of Asia.

children.value: Singapore is a famous country located in South East Asia which is a developed country with the
among the four tigers of Asia.
The temperature of Singapore is constant throughout one year. Singapore has a tropical rainforest climate. Since then, it's a wonderful destination for traveling in winter.
Singapore is ranked a financial center all over the world. Famous for it's low tax politics, Singapore is seen as a tax heaven, with many companies there.

Singapore is called the "garden city" for it's park widespread over there and "Little Red Dot" for that Singapore is always depicted as a small red point in the world map. Singaporean are proud of that Little Red Dot title for that this title shows that the influence of Singapore is not matched with its land area.
Lots of tourist attractions are in Singapore including Jewel Changi Airport where there is a beautiful inner waterfall there.
Taxi are popular in Singapore than private car due to that the lowest Taxi fee in developed countries and the hard restriction on private car.
The fertility rate in Singapore is 0.8, the lowest among developed countries.

contents.title: Reveal.js - write online ppt with Markdown
contents.description: Markdown is a great language for writing which we could just focus on the content and not the typeset from using it onward. Markdown is a good alternative for word for those who don't have too much demand for the typeset of documents.

children.value: Reveal.js - write online ppt with Markdown

Markdown is a great language for writing which we could just focus on the content and not the typeset from using it onward. Markdown is a good alternative for word for those who don't have too much demand for the typeset of documents.
Then, why don't we write .PPT file with Markdown? Someone said. Then, reveal.js debuted.

Reveal.js support Markdown syntax, so the document is easy to read and write, all features of Markdown, such as small size, easy to write mathematical formulas are also featured by reveal.js. The reveal.js must be suitable for those Markdown fans, maybe including you.
Reveal.js is easy to use. Just install the VS Code and then install the Markdown Preview Enhanced. Then, just follow the grammar and everything go well!

contents.title: How to protect my online account with TOTP?
contents.description: Today lots of people have more than one online accounts while these accounts only protected by the same password, which is easy to be pwned. If you are cared about your account safety, you should try TOTP.

children.value: How to protect my online account with TOTP?

Today lots of people have more than one online accounts while these accounts only protected by the same password, which is easy to be pwned. If you are cared about your account safety, you should try TOTP.
TOTP is the abbr of "Time-based One Time Password", which is easy to use and strong enough to protect your account most of the time.
There are two main parameters of TOTP: private key and time. The algorithm flow is shown below.

The server side (usually the website such as Google and GitHub) generate with a random private key which is usually long and hard to remember, and you can't leak it to the third party in order to protect your account.
Open your TOTP app such as one password, KeePass, scan the QR code or input the private code the server side provide you. Then, only the server side and the client side know the private key.

Every short period of time, the TOTP password with change according to the algorithm key = TOTP(Time, private key). As The private key is not known by the third party and the time is known by every one, you don't have to link your TOTP app to the Internet, so it's very safe and convenient. Even though the attacker have got your password, they can't log into your account lacking of your TOTP private key.

contents.title: The difference between a Trojan horse and a virus
contents.description: Trojans and virus are all made by hackers, some for just fun, but some for private information and money. There are so many common points between Trojan and virus, such as being harmful to your computer most of the time. How they differ from each other is shown below.

children.value: The difference between a Trojan horse and a virus

Trojans and virus are all made by hackers, some for just fun, but some for private information and money. There are so many common points between Trojan and virus, such as being harmful to your computer most of the time. How they differ from each other is shown below.
Virus: easy to spread and autonomous

Computer virus are usually developed by hackers making use of the loophole of computer systems, your computer will be destroyed by virus and your information will be leaked once virus invade your computer. But, your computer were still controlled by yourself if your computer still works.
Trojan: get the right to control the computer

Trojan is developed with the purpose of getting the right to control the computer, once your computer are invaded by Trojans, your computer will be controlled by the owner of the Trojan, whilst he could do every thing just as he wants.
So far, how virus and Trojan differ from each other is covered above, knowing about it, and it may help you some time in the future.

links.text: Virus: easy to spread and autonomous
Trojan: get the right to control the computer

contents.title: KeePass - your last password manager
contents.description: KeePass is an awesome FOSS password manager which is helpful for those who have lots of passwords and have trouble in managing them.

children.value: KeePass is an awesome FOSS password manager which is helpful for those who have lots of passwords and have trouble in managing them.
The software is easy to handle, and you should try it if you don't or don't trust or have too much money for those commercial password managers.
It recommended to use KeePass with WebDAV service such as Dropbox in order to enjoy both convenience and safety.
The KeePass is supported by all mainstream systems such as macOS, Windows and Android.
To get started with KeePass, you could download it from the official website of it easily.
Then, create the database which would be better to be verified by both the password and the key file to improve the safety.
Next step, just upload the database to your WebDAV service provider such as Dropbox while never uploading the key file. The key file and the password are recommended to only be known by yourself.
Then, reopen the KeePass database by the WebDAV link of your database, and then just operate this database as if operating your local database file.
You'd better try the awesome TOTP plugin, and set TOTP on each sites as far as you can, which could improve your account safety easily.
So far, the basic information about KeePass is shown above, have a try of it and enjoy!

contents.title: What is VMWare ESXi
contents.description: VMWare is a well-known virtual machine software which is useful for those who want to try Linux in Windows environment.

children.value: VMWare is a well-known virtual machine software which is useful for those who want to try Linux in Windows environment.
There are also a product of VMWare named VMWare ESXi less known compared to VMWare professional. How exactly do they differ from each other? I will explain it below.

VMWare professional or VMWare player(the free edition with fewer functions) are a software supported by main systems such as Windows, macOS and Android and is software-level virtual while the VMware ESXi just runs on the hardware, which is hardware-level virtual.

contents.title: Ensure your VPS safety
contents.description: It's common for a programmer or a college student to own one or more VPS, while someone takes few actions for VPS safety. They are seldom focused on the safety of VPS until their VPS is pwned or even worse when they receive the warning from VPS service provider that their VPS are detected doing illegal actions.

children.value: It's common for a programmer or a college student to own one or more VPS, while someone takes few actions for VPS safety. They are seldom focused on the safety of VPS until their VPS is pwned or even worse when they receive the warning from VPS service provider that their VPS are detected doing illegal actions.
Here are some actions you are recommended to take in order to protect your VPS safety.
1. Change the ssh port from 22 to another

The default ssh port is 22 as common knowledge and the hacker, of course, will use the 22nd port to try to log in your VPS, remember the new port should be an integer from 1025-65535 which is not occupied by other services. What's more, remember to expose the new ssh port in the console the VPS provider provide with you, or you can't log into your VPS.

Only changing the ssh port is not enough or protect your VPS as the attacker may use scanning tools such as Nmap to scan your VPS ports to get your exact ssh port, so you should create a new account with the right to use sudo command.
3. Disable the direct login of root

It's not safe to expose your root account whereby the attacker only have to know the key password after the ssh port is scanned. Just disable the root account and using the other account with sudo command is more safe.

links.text: 1. Change the ssh port from 22 to another
3. Disable the direct login of root

contents.title: The introduction to the Internet
contents.description: Nowadays, most of the people have got involved into the Internet where they share their lives or work while they don't understand the underlying theory of Internet.

children.value: Nowadays, most of the people have got involved into the Internet where they share their lives or work while they don't understand the underlying theory of Internet.
If you are one of those who don't know too much about Internet, this tutorial is for you.

The Internet made its debut during the Cold War when the world is under the cloud of nuclear weapon. The US hope to have an innovative system for responding the nuclear strike which should be decentralized as that most of the nodes in the system were still able to work as some point was destroyed to get enough deterrent against Soviet Union.

To understand the Internet, protocols are the essential notion you should grasp. The Internet work on the base of protocols, such as TCP protocol and UDP protocol. Those protocol works on the basic principle of "point to point" which means that one side sends its information as if this side directly send information to the other though they achieve it by the API provided by underlying protocols.
The Internet protocols are divided into seven parts in the ISO standard while five parts in the TCP/IP protocol stack with the latter making more sense, I think.
The five layers of Internet will be explained clearly below from below to above.

This layer is the basic layer aimed at transporting elemental information like 0 or 1, the protocols at this layer defines how to express one and zero by physical methods, like that high level of electric correspond to one while low one correspond to zero.
This layer provides the ability to send information to other nodes between the LAN(Local Area Network) using MAC(Media Access Control) address depicting each point.

Not confused with the Internet which contains the protocol of this layer. The well_known IP protocol is at this layer as well. Protocols of this layer(especially the IP protocol) provides the ability to negotiate with other nodes not in the same network by using the IP address consists of the network number describing the network the node locate and the address describing where the node locate in the network.

Transport layer is a layer providing the ability to choice which method to use in order to transport information as the programmer want. Two famous protocols there are TCP(Transmission Control Protocol) and UDP(User Datagram Protocol). The TCP are used most of the time while the UDP are used for some special scenes needing high transmission speed and low accuracy. The fourth layer is the lowest layer application programmers could touch.
The application layer is just those web apps we use daily, such as the E-mail, HTTPS, HTTP.

contents.title: How Chromium and Chrome differ from each other
contents.description: The logo of Chrome and Chromium only differ in the color - the logo of Chromium is blue while Chrome is green, red and blue, and they are all developed by Google with the same UI, which is hard to distinguish between each other.

children.value: How Chromium and Chrome differ from each other

The logo of Chrome and Chromium only differ in the color - the logo of Chromium is blue while Chrome is green, red and blue, and they are all developed by Google with the same UI, which is hard to distinguish between each other.

The Chrome browser is commercial which means that the original code is not known by the others except the Chrome developer while the Chromium is FOSS(Free and Open-Source Software) which means that the original code is shown to anyone.
Chrome is usually better than Chromium in performances as it is commercial maintained by Google while all the upside of Chromium is absorbed in Chrome.
However, Chromium is maintained by the community and the code is open to anyone, so there would be less backdoor than Chrome.

There are two choice: convenience and privacy, if you prefer convenience, choose Chrome, and if you prefer the other, choose Chromium. But that don't mean that one of them is absolutely lost if the other is chosen, in fact they both work well in each side.

contents.title: A brief introduction to Ventoy

only one system could be in the U disk

enter this official website and install it as the instruction.

There are lots of register of Vim which stores code copied or clipped to be pasted somewhere.
The usage of registers is easy.

before your instructions, is the same as

register.
For example: in order to copy the code in the line your cursor at, type
Yesterday I had read an article about the strict copyright protection of Nintendo which arise the debate whether copyright protection benefits the creation.
Two opposing views exists about this issue.

The copyright protection is harmful for creation as authors couldn't use those proprietary material freely. What's more, the copyright protection inhibits the circulation of creative works making people hard to contact with those works.
The copyright protection benefits creation as the authors could get the profits by selling their works which encourages them to continuously make good jobs.

In my opinion, There are two kinds of creation: one is based on interest, and the other is based on profits. The copyright protection will definitely harm the former one and benefit the latter one. Whether to protect copyright depends on your preference.

contents.title: How to sign up Google without phone number
contents.description: At least ten year ago(2012), there is no phone number needed to sign up Google. However, in 2022, things changed, whenever signing up a Google account, you will be required to give your phone number to "ensure you are not a robot". However, associating with phone number could be vulnerable as the phone number is associated with your private information. Using virtual number is not as useful as in the past, as most of the virtual number is disabled by Google for signing up too many times.

Using virtual number is not as useful as in the past, as most of the virtual number is disabled by Google for signing up too many times.

In mobile phone: Download the Google official app as signing up in it is not phone number needing.
In PC: Download the Google Chrome, and sign up in it.

Interpolation function is a function that
Mastering numerical analyze is not needed as the SciPy module have provided all the methods you will need to solve problem of this kind.

props.code:
import numpy as np
from scipy import interpolate

children.value: are divided into many parts such as

props.code:
# Linear interpolation
f_linear = interpolate.interp1d(x, y)
# B-spline interpolation

for kind in ['nearest', 'zero', 'linear', 'quadratic', 'cubic']:
    f = interpolate.interp1d(x, y, kind=kind)

children.value: Curve fitting is the process of constructing of a curve or mathematical function, that has the best fit to the data points given. The least squares fitting are the most common method for curve fitting.

props.code:
import numpy as np
from scipy.optimize import leastsq

# f(x) defines the distance between your fitting function with the actual points
def f(p): 
    k, b = p
    return (Y - (k*x + b))

r = leastsq(f, [1, 0]) # the latter param is the initial k and b given
k, b = r[0]

corresponding to the three coefficients of
, A_gq and b_eq corresponding yo the coefficients of
There are two type of method respectively used to solve either minimum problem or maximum problem:
. We choose the latter according to the pattern of this problem.

# If this is a maximum value problem, substitute LpMinimize with Lpmaximize.
m = pp.LpProblem(sense=pp.LpMinimize)

children.value: # If this is a maximum value problem, substitute LpMinimize with Lpmaximize.

props.code:

# x_1, x_2 and x_3 are all nutural number, so set lowBound=0 and cat='Integer'
x = [pp.LpVariable(f'x{i}', lowBound=0, cat='Integer') for i in [1, 2, 3]]

children.value: # define x_1, x_2 and x_3 in a list

props.code:
# corrspond to z
m += pp.lpDot(c, x)

for i in range(len(A_gq)):
    m += pp.lpDot(A_gq[i], x) >= b_gq[i]

print('minimum value of z:', pp.value(m.objective) )
print('coefficients:', [pp.value(var) for var in x])

contents.title: Nonlinear programming
contents.description: Nonlinear programming is the dedicated means by which solving nonlinear function problems.

children.value: Nonlinear programming is the dedicated means by which solving nonlinear function problems.
We use the Scipy module of Python3 dedicated for mathematical and scientifical problem to solve this problem.

props.code:
# If maxmize problem, trans it to minimize problem manually
from scipy.optimize import minimize 
import numpy as np

children.value: # If maxmize problem, trans it to minimize problem manually
The most important method for solving nonlinear problem is showed below:

props.code:
minimize(fun, x0, args=(), method=None, jac=None, hess=None,
         hessp=None, bounds=None, constraints=(), tol=None,
         callback=None, options=None)

children.value: Don't put too much pressure on youuself despite lots of params of this method as you only have to handle four out of them:
fun corresponds to the function and that of the problem above is:
x0 corresponds to the start point to which you guess where the input the answer corresponds.
method is the method you hope to use during solving the problem as its name shows.
constrains are the constrains showed in the problem and that of the problem above is:
Then, this problem is just easy to solve in less than one second after the problem has been described clearly to the computer.

props.code:
# x[0] and x[1] correspond to x_1 and x_2 respectively
fun = lambda x: 2 * x[0] ** 2 - 4 * x[0] * x[1] + 4 * x[1] ** 2 - 6 * x[0] - 3 * x[1]

# ineq means that the fun >= 0, so the first fun means that x_1 >= 0\\
# the third means that x_1 + x_2 <= 3
cons = ({'type': 'ineq', 'fun': lambda x: x[0]},
        {'type': 'ineq', 'fun': lambda x: x[1]},
        {'type': 'ineq', 'fun': lambda x: 3 - x[0] - x[1]},
        {'type': 'ineq', 'fun': lambda x: 9 - 4*x[0] - x[1]})

x0 = np.asarray((0.5, 0.5))

res = minimize(fun(), x0, method='SLSQP', constraints=cons)

print(res.fun,res.success,res.x,res.status)

children.value: # x[0] and x[1] correspond to x_1 and x_2 respectively
# ineq means that the fun >= 0, so the first fun means that x_1 >= 0\\
# the third means that x_1 + x_2 <= 3

props.code:
# If maxmize problem, trans it to minimize problem manually
from scipy.optimize import minimize 
import numpy as np


# x[0] and x[1] correspond to x_1 and x_2 respectively
fun = lambda x: 2 * x[0] ** 2 - 4 * x[0] * x[1] + 4 * x[1] ** 2 - 6 * x[0] - 3 * x[1]

# ineq means that the fun >= 0, so the first fun means that x_1 >= 0\\
# the third means that x_1 + x_2 <= 3
cons = ({'type': 'ineq', 'fun': lambda x: x[0]},
        {'type': 'ineq', 'fun': lambda x: x[1]},
        {'type': 'ineq', 'fun': lambda x: 3 - x[0] - x[1]},
        {'type': 'ineq', 'fun': lambda x: 9 - 4*x[0] - x[1]})

x0 = np.asarray((0.5, 0.5))

res = minimize(fun(), x0, method='SLSQP', constraints=cons)

print(res.fun,res.success,res.x,res.status)

# output: -11.024999999999931 True [1.95 1.05] 0

children.value: # If maxmize problem, trans it to minimize problem manually
# x[0] and x[1] correspond to x_1 and x_2 respectively
# ineq means that the fun >= 0, so the first fun means that x_1 >= 0\\
# the third means that x_1 + x_2 <= 3
